required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Implications for Management of PET Amyloid Classification Technology in the Imaging Dementia(IDEAS) Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Implications for Management of PET Amyloid Classification Technology in the Imaging Dementia(IDEAS) Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to build upon the evidence captured in the Imaging Dementia - Evidence for Amyloid Scanning (IDEAS; NCT02420756) trial to include valuable information regarding patient-reported outcomes and physician confidence in diagnosis and management based on the Implications for Management of PET Amyloid Classification Technology (IMPACT; NCT number not yet assigned) trial design.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary purpose of this prospective, observational study is to examine the benefit of amyloid positron emission tomography and computed tomography (PET/CT) scan in clinical practice for participants at our site that are enrolled in the IDEAS (NCT02420756) trial. To accomplish this, when a clinician has ordered an amyloid PET scan, the investigators will assess the impact of [18F]Flutemetamol PET/CT scans on 1) physician diagnosis and management as it relates to care practices and drug management, and 2) patient reported outcomes in patients evaluated in the Cognitive Disorders Clinic at the University of Utah and meeting Appropriate Use Criteria (AUC) for clinical amyloid PET/CT scans. A secondary purpose is to compare the semi-quantitative assessment of amyloid plaque burden using vendor supplied software and standard visual assessment of amyloid positivity.
The primary hypothesis is that, in diagnostically uncertain cases, knowledge of amyloid status as determined by amyloid PET/CT scans may alter patient diagnosis and management and lead to significant changes in patient and family reported outcomes. A secondary hypothesis is that vendor supplied semi-quantitative assessment of amyloid plaque positivity will be superior to standard visual criteria assessments.
Objectives
AIM 1: to assess the change in diagnosis and management, related to care practices and drug management of adult patients being evaluated for cognitive deficits and meeting Appropriate Use Criteria (AUC)
AIM 2: to assess the change of amyloid PET/ CT scans on patient-reported outcomes involving care partner confidence and satisfaction
AIM 3: to assess confidence increase through use of vendor supplied semi-quantitative software
AIM 4: to assess adherence to identified patient management related to care practices and drug management

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of change in care practices after amyloid PET scan
primary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
primary_outcome.description: % of 13 care practices that differ before and after the amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of change in drug management options after amyloid PET
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: % of drug management options that differ before and after the amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in % likelihood of Alzheimer's disease (AD) diagnosis after amyloid PET scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in % of AD likelihood identified before and after the amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of change in leading diagnosis after amyloid PET
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: % of leading diagnosis that differ before and after amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physician confidence in leading diagnosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in 5-point scale of physician confidence in leading diagnosis before and after amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in care partner's confidence in diagnosis after amyloid PET
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan, Visit 4, 90 days after scan, Visit 5, 180 days after scan and Visit 6, 270 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in 5-point scale of care partner confidence in diagnosis before and after amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in care partner satisfaction with evaluation after amyloid PET
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in 5-point scale of care partner satisfaction before team care and after amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in care partner assessment of the quality of evaluation after amyloid PET
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, 30 days prior to scan and Visit 4, 90 days after scan
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in 5-point scale of care partner quality before team care and after amyloid PET scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of care partners finding amyloid PET scan worthwhile
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of care partners indicating they would agree to do an amyloid PET again on a yes/no/don't know scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion exhibiting increased behavior disturbance during amyloid scan visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 1, Visit 2, Visit 3, and Visit 4 90 days post scan
secondary_outcome.description: % of patients showing a difference in the 44-point Catastrophic Reaction Scale between the median value in all non-scan visits and the value in the amyloid PET scan visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of change exhibiting increased behavior disturbance when the diagnosis is given
secondary_outcome.description: % of patients showing a difference in the 44-point Catastrophic Reaction Scale between Visit 1 and Visit 3 when learning the result of the scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Care partner's sustained confidence in diagnosis received after amyloid PET scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 4, Visit 5, and Visit 6, 270 days post scan
secondary_outcome.description: Care partner confidence in diagnosis received after amyloid PET scan on a 5-point scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Care partner's sustained confidence in ability to adhere to management plan received after amyloid PET scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 4, Visit 5, and Visit 6, 270 days post scan
secondary_outcome.description: Care partner confidence in ability to follow management plan outlined by physician after amyloid PET scan on a 5-point scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of recommended care practices adhered to after amyloid PET scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 4, Visit 5, and Visit 6, 270 days post scan
secondary_outcome.description: % of care practices recommended after amyloid PET scan reported by care partner

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of recommended drug management adhered to after amyloid PET scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 4, Visit 5, and Visit 6, 270 days post scan
secondary_outcome.description: % of drug management options recommended after amyloid PET scan reported by care partner

other_outcome.measure: Change in the interpretation of amyloid PET scans with semi-quantitative image analysis
other_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days post amyloid PET scan
other_outcome.description: Difference in a 5-point measure of amyloid scan positivity between a qualitative and semi-quantitative image analysis

arm_group.description: All consented IDEAS trial participants will have additional data collected: visual and semi-quantitative software aided amyloid PET scan interpretation, care partner questionnaires and documented provider diagnosis, diagnostic confidence, and management plan following the IMPACT design

study_pop.textblock: Participants must be Medicare beneficiaries referred by qualified dementia specialists and must meet AUC for amyloid PET (Johnson et al. 2013).

overall_official.affiliation: Director: Center for Alzheimer's Care, Imaging & Research; Chief: Division of Cognitive Neurology; Senior Investigator: The Brain Institute; Professor: Dept. of Neurology University of Utah School of Medicine
